meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in a pitching competition.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah managed to outpitch all her opponents with her accurate throws.
meanings.sent2: The young pitcher hoped to outpitch the experienced players in the upcoming tournament.
meanings.sent3: The little league team was surprised to see their coach outpitch them effortlessly during practice.
meanings.sent4: In the final inning, the underdog team outpitched the reigning champions to claim victory.
meanings.sent5: His determination to outpitch his rivals fueled his intense training sessions.

meanings.definition: To excel or outperform in pitching.
meanings.sent1: Despite his size, the pitcher managed to outpitch all his teammates with his accuracy.
meanings.sent2: The star player always aimed to outpitch himself in every game.
meanings.sent3: The robot pitcher was programmed to outpitch any human opponent it faced.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the sport drove her to outpitch even the most skilled players.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's dream was to outpitch the best pitchers in the league.

meanings.definition: To outdo or outshine in pitching.
meanings.sent1: The rookie pitcher surprised everyone by outpitching the veteran players in the match.
meanings.sent2: The determined pitcher set out to outpitch his own personal record.
meanings.sent3: The pitcher's unique style allowed him to outpitch his competitors effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to practice helped her outpitch her rivals in the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The pitcher's unwavering focus enabled him to outpitch even the toughest opponents.
